Posts.Content: Aug 21, 2009 02:02PM Becky613 wrote: I had the wire or it was called a needle localization for my lumpectomy.  I was given local before plus I already had my IV started.  The wire killed when it was placed but then I didn't feel it just a couple of seconds after.  It was covered with a gauze and my gown was OK over it.  Kind of fun to get up to the BR with IV, and that wire sticking out of my breast.  I was surprised with the pain at insert but was really OK after that.  I was on a stretcher from the time my IV was started until wheeled into surgery. Best of luck...try not to worried and too bad you didn't get a call back. Becky
Posts.Title: does the wire hurt in an excisional biopsy?? debnyc JCinAZ

Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2009 10:10PM Becky613 wrote: Anxiousmama:  I have just completed 26 out of 35 treatments.  The first treatment for me was about 30 minutes.  They rechecked alignment and positioning.  They had said the first treatment would take 45 minutes so they were quick I thought.  Good luck.
